definition: to welcome/to meet/to face/to forge ahead (esp. in the face of difficulties)
to walk (side part of split character)
to welcome a guest/to entertain a customer (of prostitute)
lit. (bamboo) splits when it meets the knife's edge (idiom)/fig. easily solved
(of a groom) to escort the bride to the wedding ceremony/fig. to take as one's wife/to marry
to see in the New Year/to welcome new guests/by extension, to receive new students
(of the groom's family) to send a bridal sedan chair 花轎|花轿 to fetch the bride/to send a party to escort the bride to the groom's house
to try hard to catch up

sentences.english: And the Philistine came on and drew near unto David; and the man that bare the shield went before him.
sentences.chinese: 非利士人也渐渐的迎着大卫来拿盾牌的走在前头。

sentences.english: Welcome Olympic, deliver civilization, build up new spirit.
And tomorrow we'll fly around the sun together.
sentences.chinese: 明天我们将迎着太阳起来。

sentences.english: As I inhale the impalpable breezes that set in upon me.
sentences.chinese: 迎隐晦之风我猛吸气轻风荡漾心旗。

sentences.english: Even to thy pure and most most loving breast.
sentences.chinese: 迎我到你最亲的纯洁的胸间。

sentences.english: Forsaking all I've fallen for, I rise to meet the end.
sentences.chinese: 抛弃那些我曾依恋的一切，我往上迎向我的尽头。

sentences.english: With the voice of the 21 century, it is smiling to face the challenge.
sentences.chinese: 在跨世纪新时代的号声中，笑迎八面来风。

sentences.english: His unpopular views him a social leper.
sentences.chinese: 他因观点郴受级迎而见弃于社会。

sentences.english: Pursue your object be it what it will steadily and indefatigably.
sentences.chinese: 不管追求什么目标，都迎坚持不懈。

sentences.english: Riding morning breeze, the trailing green villus welcome the visitors with its infinite green.
sentences.chinese: 乘着晨风，蔓绿绒以无限的绿意迎迓游客。

sentences.english: Arsenal are hoping to have midfielder Abou Diaby available for Saturday's game against Stoke.
sentences.chinese: 周六对斯托克城的比赛阿森纳有希望迎回迪亚比。

sentences.english: And the young man went to the gangway.
sentences.chinese: 说完那青年人就向舷门那儿迎过去了。

sentences.english: But when Kay walked in, he rushed up to her.
sentences.chinese: 当凯走进来时，他却急忙迎上前去。

sentences.english: They greet her with a smile, like the Arc de Triomphe to welcome the return of the hero.
sentences.chinese: 他们笑着迎她，像迎接凯旋归来的英雄。

sentences.english: They are all heroes grasping the nettle.
sentences.chinese: 他们都是迎着艰险上的英雄。

definition: to hurry/to rush/to run quickly/to elope
variant of 奔[ben1]/variant of 奔[ben4]
to throw oneself at/to pounce on/to devote one's energies/to flap/to flutter/to dab/to pat/to bend over
in big strides/(fig.) in giant steps
a breed of horse/variant of 歡|欢[huan1]
to hold/to embrace/to wrap around/to gather around (sb)/to throng/to swarm/to support/Taiwan pr. [yong3]
to hope for/to long for/to expect
to overtake/to catch up with/to hurry/to rush/to try to catch (the bus etc)/to drive (cattle etc) forward/to drive (sb) away/to avail oneself of (an opportunity)/until
